channel.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
channel.description:
Seeing as it's 1am where I live, I couldn't be bothered to go to the doctors at this very instant. Just curious because I know a few of you are fitness freaks, but how does one tell a cramp from ligament damage?
Today while playing rugby I landed on both of my legs very awkwardly and they both gave out from underneath me when I rolled away from the tackle, and I fell flat on my face - only to notice that my ankles were basically pointing < > and I was in extreme agony in my calf muscles on both legs that no matter what I did nothing elevatiating the pain.. I had it massaged and stretched, but yet to no avail and it still hurts an intense pain when I tense that muscle a little.
By the way, I've had calf cramps before (not often, but every now and then I get them while training), but none were this extreme. I have a fairly good tolerance when it comes to pain (by that I mean, I'm no stranger to broken bones or injuries).. but this was not a cramp like pain, this was more the feeling of complete shatter of a muscle. When the first aid officer rolled down my socks he told me he began to worry because my muscle wasn't in a spasm like it would in a cramp.
I'm thinking it could still be cramped up a little (well, I'm hoping atleast). However I'm beginning to think otherwise.

item.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Yeah, turns out I tore all the ligaments up my leg and dislocated my left ankle and smashed the fuck out of my right ankle… which means no more Rugby for me this year. LOL fuck my life, first round in -.-

Read full topic
item.source: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?

item.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Sounds fucking nasty. Given the level of pain you’ve described, I’d play it safe and visit a doctor regardless of what anyone tells you here.
ALSO, I don’t understand why a picture of me was dragged into this.

Read full topic
item.source: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?

item.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Hyperextension of the muscle, meaning that you extended the calf muscle far further than the neutral position (hyperextension can be of joints and muscles).

Read full topic
item.source: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?

item.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“TheBeanie, post:5, topic:337123”]Bring out the magic spray… it works wonders for footballers

I wouldnt have thought cramps would come on as soon as you landed…[/quote]
It wasn’t really ‘landing’ per-say… One of their Props ran the ball up the ruck and I tackled him head on and began driving him back (it was a fucking dominate tackle to say the least), however when I lifted him up I felt excruciating pain in both calves, and then when I landed on top of him and rolled away was when I realized I’d done the damage.

I’m going to get it assessed tomorrow because it still hasn’t gotten any better, and the muscle is still tender as fuck.

Read full topic
item.source: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?

item.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

maybe you tore a muscles? eating to much salt also gives you cramps. My cramps don’t last longer than 5-10 minutes

Read full topic

item.title: Severe calf cramp or ligament damage?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Do you drink enough water? A lot of muscle problems come from not drinking a fair amount of water.

Read full topic
